creator: bhearsum@mozilla.com
summary: "TypeError: this._highlighterEnv is null" errors prevent mouse interaction on certain pages

assigned_to_detail.name: nobody@mozilla.org
assigned_to_detail.real_name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

comments.text:
This is happening to me consistently on https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1450035 (but not other bugzilla pages) since updating to 20180517100441 (I was previously on 20180516100125).

I don't have the devtools open, but the traceback I'm getting comes from it, and I see there was an update to devtools in the regression range (https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1461479).
comments.author: bhearsum@mozilla.com

comments.text:
I could not reproduce this problem. Do you mind providing specific steps to reproduce this? Just open the page and try to click on things? Without even opening devtools first?
Also, is this with Firefox Nightly, Beta, Release? Which operating system are you on?
Finally, can you provide the regression range?
comments.author: pbrosset@mozilla.com

comments.text:
Unfortunately, I can't reproduce this anymore. This was one Nightly with the buildid 20180517100441. It looks like the regression range is https://hg.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/pushloghtml?fromchange=dedd25bfd2794eaba95225361f82c701e49c9339&tochange=8fb36531f7d05c4a7127750589cd1736113d2d53

And yes - I was hitting the issue without devtools open.
comments.author: bhearsum@mozilla.com

comments.text: Thank you for checking. Let's close for now then.
comments.author: pbrosset@mozilla.com
